14937780ed1da4f4e381c73a0e0c9dbf (21:57): should I be wrapping those blocks with a wrapper? is that sort of thing still necessary so as to avoid the paragraph overflow issue below ?
14937780ed1da4f4e381c73a0e0c9dbf (21:58): yes I could set .clearing on that paragraph but I'm anticipating this content will be in wordpress, so the 'client' won't think to add classes in that manner

14937780ed1da4f4e381c73a0e0c9dbf (21:58): trying to think if there's a better way to work around the issue in another fashion when you cannot depend on adding a clearing class to the element following the last box
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:10): is there a more css3 approach to using jquery to zebra stirpe a table then just adding an odd and even class etc... ?
52b6d0acc8828468b85687739d7b5abb (22:11): using the :odd and :even psuedo classes?
bb268da6cc8db61b826a3225313a00e7 (22:12): 549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347: :nth-child(even) and :nth-child(odd)
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:13): $('table#table_id tr:nth-child(even).css('background-color', '#ddd');
6d2cddd61c68e5e8d13a65f218e358f5 (22:15): Evening.
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:16): yup that worked!
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:25): bb268da6cc8db61b826a3225313a00e7 how do I make it skip the first row?
bb268da6cc8db61b826a3225313a00e7 (22:41): 549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347: maybe use :first-child with its own style overrides
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:44): this is not working: $('article#excel').css({'float':'left', 'font-size':'20px'});
66ac8412c3aa86545c46679cf3528c98 (22:44): 549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347: Remember the closing quote in:  $('table#table_id tr:nth-child(even).css('background-color', '#ddd');
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:45): yes I did see that problem before thanks :>
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:45): any ideas why my article approach is not working?
66ac8412c3aa86545c46679cf3528c98 (22:45): 549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347: Hmm, and excel is an ID within article?
66ac8412c3aa86545c46679cf3528c98 (22:47): Well, do you have a console window open?
66ac8412c3aa86545c46679cf3528c98 (22:47): What does $('article#excel') return?
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:48): The value of the property '$' is null or undefined, not a Function object"
66ac8412c3aa86545c46679cf3528c98 (22:48): So it isn't finding it
66ac8412c3aa86545c46679cf3528c98 (22:49): You have some sort of <article> tag with something <blah id="excel"> in it?
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:49): <article id='excel'>
5bdd73a09b1fab8884c1e442bf432697 (22:50): it means $ does not exist, so it means you have problems with loading jQuery
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:51): well jquery is functioning on this page
66ac8412c3aa86545c46679cf3528c98 (22:51): Note to self, read the whole sentence instead of just seeing "null or undefined"
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:51): don't know why the console can't use it
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:51): but it is in a frame
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:51): the bottom frame
66ac8412c3aa86545c46679cf3528c98 (22:51): Well that's why. The main window doesn't have jQuery loaded
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:52): is there a trick to get around that somehow?
66ac8412c3aa86545c46679cf3528c98 (22:52): Well, what is the name of the bottom window?
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:54): its name is bottomframe
66ac8412c3aa86545c46679cf3528c98 (22:58): Alright, so then window.frames["bottomframe"].$("article#excel");
66ac8412c3aa86545c46679cf3528c98 (22:59): Sorry about the short delay, I'm at work :p
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (22:59): very cool, thanks, I will try it

549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (23:10): but supposedly its not needed

549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (23:22): what is the best way to do a css3 linear gradient with jquery?
24a4daaade8d75df84ce0a300831718e (23:22): what? css3
24a4daaade8d75df84ce0a300831718e (23:22): or svg
24a4daaade8d75df84ce0a300831718e (23:23): or inline b64 svg
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (23:23): I want a pure jquery solution
24a4daaade8d75df84ce0a300831718e (23:23): go to #jquery, then
66ac8412c3aa86545c46679cf3528c98 (23:23): Here is a 'pure' CSS tool: http://www.colorzilla.com/gradient-editor/
66ac8412c3aa86545c46679cf3528c98 (23:24): I'm not sure what you mean by creating a gradient with jQuery though - jQuery would only apply the gradient you give it
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (23:24): well ie 7 doesn't support linear-gradient
549514cbc38221dd70ea22d4a5462347 (23:25): so you have to use jquery to make the linear-gradient

01bdd2dddd25e5f4c26427945372c78d (23:49): how much difference do long vs short id and class names make ?
46d12719e3f2e70f82f117b7b0b7cc27 (23:50): like, performance wise?
01bdd2dddd25e5f4c26427945372c78d (23:51): 46d12719e3f2e70f82f117b7b0b7cc27: memory use, performance, parsing, don't know
46d12719e3f2e70f82f117b7b0b7cc27 (23:51): generally speaking... id/class names should be as semantic and concise as possible.
46d12719e3f2e70f82f117b7b0b7cc27 (23:53): as far as perf stuff is concerned, I don't think you have too much to worry about.
